text:
Perfect! I have successfully added all the attribution information for Willem Gielen MD to the VisibleDx application. Here's what I've implemented:

## ✅ **Attribution Added Successfully**

### **1. Creator Attribution in Footer** 
- Added Willem Gielen MD's name with clickable LinkedIn profile link
- Added Nordjysk Speciallaegeklinik organization with website link  
- Added location: Hjørring, Denmark
- Added MIT License badge
- Updated footer copyright to "© 2024 Willem Gielen MD - MIT License"

### **2. Multi-language Support**
- Updated all 3 language files (English, Dutch, Danish) with creator information
- Added proper translation types for the creator section
- Maintained consistency across all languages

### **3. Visual Implementation**
- Enhanced disclaimer footer component to include creator section
- Added User icon and proper styling
- Made both LinkedIn profile and organization website clickable with external link icons
- Organized footer into 4-column layout for better information display

### **4. Official MIT LICENSE File**
- Created proper LICENSE file with Willem Gielen MD as copyright holder
- Included educational disclaimer emphasizing training-only use
- Added creator contact information and organization details
- Followed standard MIT license format

### **5. URLs Included**
- **LinkedIn**: https://www.linkedin.com/in/willem-gielen/
- **Organization**: https://www.nordjyskklinik.dk/

The app now properly credits Willem Gielen MD as the creator and clearly displays the MIT license and educational nature of the tool across all languages. The attribution appears prominently in the footer with clickable links to his professional profiles and organization.
